runs.comm: nudged off the pads in front of square leg
short ball outside leg stump, Dilshan waits for it and pulls past the fielder at short fine leg
Dilshan is not letting McCullum settle, slamming the slower and fuller ball high and far over wide long-on. He came down the track and got to the pitch of the ball before swinging hard
played off the front foot to pint
shorter ball and Dilshan pulls through square  leg
he steps out again, getting to the pitch of a ball that is doing nothing, and lofts back over the bowler's head for a one-bounce four
good length and straight, Mahela waits and defends on the front foot
Mahela strides out and punches a delivery that shapes away from him a little towards cover point
dropped with soft hands towards the off side and Dilshan responds quickly to Mahela's call

Dilshan tries to drive a good length ball a bit too hard and mis-times to mid-on, he sprints for a single and collides with Nathan McCullum who was coming in to collect the throw. McCullum tumbles to the ground
played towards wide mid-on for a single
good length on off stump, played towards cover from the crease
terrific shot! Mahela moves forward and towards the off side to flick a full ball off his pads over the long leg boundary. Sublime timing
good length on middle stump, Mahela stays balanced and nudges towards midwicket
Dilshan stays in his crease to a delivery that is a bit too full and gets an inside edge behind square leg as he tries to push forward
a slower ball on off and middle, Mahela stays in his crease and drops the ball on the off side for a quick single
a slower ball out of the back of the hand, Dilshan waits in his crease and hits to backward point, didn't time it well
Mahela dabs the ball off the back foot towards backward point, all the fielders are on the edge of the circle so singles are easily available
superb drive, Mahela moves forward and laces the full ball outside off stump through extra cover with a flowing drive
the slower ball outside off stump, Mahela lets it go
terrific, Mahela steps out of his crease and moves towards leg to make room, he then frees his arms, lofting the length ball flat and inside out over the extra cover boundary
nudged from the crease on the leg side
a slower ball on middle and leg, Mahela leans across and flicks behind square
another slower one, which Dilshan work towards midwicket
that's far too short and Dilshan has sent the ball over the square leg boundary by rocking on to the back foot and pulling hard
Southee replies with a bouncer but it's too high, Sri Lanka reach 50
length ball outside off stump, Dilshan flays his bat at it, driving powerfully through cover point for another boundary
Dilshan drives the ball hard and in the air towards the bowler's right, it's not really a chance and the ball hits the bowler's boot and goes on the leg side
Mahela tries to dab one that is too full and bounces sharply as well towards third man, he gets beaten. Southee appeals loudly but Brendon McCullum does not
watch out in the crowd! Mahela is standing outside his crease and launches the length ball off the front foot, simply driving it high and far over deep midwicket
in the blockhole outside off stump, played towards cover point for a single
Mahela makes room and dabs the length ball to third man
good length outside off, Dilshan goes back and cuts to point
for once Mahela mis-times the drive, hitting it uppishly but well short of extra cover
Mahela charges and swings across the line, not pretty, he gets an inside edge on to the pad for a run on the off side
Dilshan stays back and nudges the ball in front of square
Mahela makes room by moving towards leg and cuts a short of a length ball behind point, Mills runs to his right from third man and slides to save the four
played on the leg side for a single
Mahela gets down on one knee and uses the angle and pace into him to sweep firmly to the long leg boundary. He got his pad outside off stump to play that shot
Mahela stays in his crease and plays towards long on
played back to the bowler
Dilshan drives the ball through point for another single
Mahela makes room and lofts the ball inside out through the vacant extra cover
short of a length outside off, Mahela is perfectly balanced as he watches the ball all the way and dabs it late to the third man boundary, he placed it so fine
he's been caught at fine leg! Mahela tried to pull a ball that was a bit too full and he top edged it to Vettori, who ran forward and to his right to take the catch
Oram appeals for lbw but that's going down leg, Dilshan missed the flick
Dilshan dabs a short of a length ball to the third man boundary, waiting for it and playing it very late
once again Dilshan opens the face to play the short of a length ball towards third man
Sangakkara tries to drive through cover but mis-times it towards the bowler
off stump, driven down to long off
leg stump line, tickled to midwicket
a step down, chipped down to long on, one bounce in front of the fielder
played with the angle past square leg with a flick
a step down, dropped in shorter, patted back towards the bowler and it nearly carries to the bowler, not quite
a step down again and this time nails it over midwicket, picked up very wel
length ball around off stump, punched to point
back of a length, a slap back towards the bowler, got cramped for room, takes a single towards mid on
slower, shorter ball, Dilshan stays in the crease and chops it down to third man
sliding across the left-hander, Sangakkara tries to stay in the crease and square drive, misses
terrible bowling, short and Sangakkara rocks back and slaps it to the backward square fence
another short one and slapped to the midwicket fence this time
length ball on middle and leg, paddle swept to deep square leg
aha, a fuller ball, driven down to long off for one
full again, outside off, driven towards deep cover, wide enough for a couple
rolled down to long off, no need for risks
gives himself room and picks it up and over extra cover, timed beautifully to the boundary
slides down the leg side now
full on off stump, tucked to midwicket
fullish outside off, goes to cut and it skips under the stroke
meets it on the full, punched down the ground to long on
outside off, slapped to long off coming forward
angled in, goes to sweep, gets it to the 45
dragged down, pulled out to deep square leg off the toe of the bat
length ball, forced into the leg side off the back foot, just evades short midwicket's slide

full and flicked out to deep midwicket, they refuse the second and Sangakkara is really struggling but the throw is wild and McCullum has to go a long way to take it and get back to the stumps but he gets there and Sangakkara has to go, giving New Zealand a glimpse of an opening. There was a muddle-up in considering the second and Sangakkara was sent back, terminally
full on leg stump, fumbled at short midwicket so they take two
full again, clipped down to long on
length just outside off, pushed to point
full just outside off, calmly pushed into the covers
length around off stump, punched to extra cover
flat ball, slapped to extra cover but Ross Taylor again lets the ball run off him and down to long on
flatter and too short, paddled out to deep square
better, fuller outside off, dropped around point
just outside off, a back away and punched through covers
chopped into midwicket from back of a length
step back and cut down the ground, saved well by the bowler
back of a length outside off, cut off a bottom edge, doesn't run far enough past the keeper
swept away out to the deep fielder square on the leg side
too short and pulled behind square, helped on it's way

driven into the off side but arial and taken at extra cover. A good time for Taylor to get his fielding spot on, taking a sharp low chance down to his right-hand side. It was driven from about off stump, full of length, it didn't get up that far off the ground but enough to produce a chance that was well held
full outside off, punched down to long off
full and wide of off stump, driven out to the cover sweeper
floated up onto off stump, awkwardly played back to the bowler
off stump, meets it on the full, punched down to long off
middle stump, again met on the full, whipped out to deep midwicket
touch shorter, again just one worked away through square leg
middle and leg, again flicked into the leg side for just a single
and ends with a dot ball, forced away from a full length to extra cover
a step down the track, reaching for it and it comes off a wild outside edge towards deep cover, fortunately lands short of the fielder
too wide, driven past extra cover with great timing to beat long off
given room again but a slower ball, chopped out to the cover sweeper
slower ball just outside off, clears the front leg and slaps it down to long on, stretching for it
well bowled, right up in the block hole, pushed out to extra cover
a wild swing to a straight ball, inside edge past short long leg and Oram dives and saves brilliantly on the deep backward square rope, could be a vital save that
full ball, which Dilshan tries to smash over long-on but mis-times it. The ball reaches the fielder on the bounce
full ball angling across the right-hander, Mathews drives towards extra cover
Dilshan makes room by moving outside leg, Southee cramps him with a yorker, Dilshan squeezes it out towards midwicket and they take on Guptill's arm to complete the second
nearly in the blockhole around off and middle, driven from the crease through cover point
once again Southee finds the blockhole and gives Mathews no room, the batsman hits towards long on
a terrific over from Southee, Dilshan plays the final blockhole delivery towards long on
full toss just outside off and smashed over midwicket into the crowd

cut out to the deep fielder at cover, Southee returns well, and Dilshan is diving in coming back for the second and is short of his ground he was desperate to come back and keep the strike but a great piece of work on the cover boundary again gives New Zealand hope
outside off, slugged down the ground to long on from a length
full outside off, dug out down the ground again, Franklin nearly fielded it but couldn't hold it, another single to long on
full and wide, swung away off an outside edge, third man is up and that will run away for four, poor ball, giving the batsman the chance to free his arms
slower ball on off stump and Perera swings and loses his off stump. Franklin atoning slightly, bowling a great slower ball on a good length, Perera took a huge swipe at it and lost his off stump
full and cracked out to cover, well fielded
full outside off, goes for the ramp and gets it off the toe of the bat in the air towards short long leg, doesn't get it at all and it falls short of the fielder
full ball on leg stump, dug out through midwicket for...just a single as the fielder scrambles well off the rope
full and wide enough of the attempted drive, beats the bat, dot ball!
full and wide, goes for the ramp and this time pulls it off! What a shot, picked it up from well outside off and it sails over short long leg

slap into the off side off an inside edge, easy run out at point surely to the non-striker's end but I think Taylor dropped the ball, he did! Taylor dropped it and Sri Lanka have won!! But no!! On the replay the ball has deflected off Taylor's hand and deflected into the stumps!!! Amazing stuff so New Zealand have effected the run out and this is going to be a Super Over...so much checking to see what actually caused the bails to come off but it looks as if it was ball...here comes the third umpire...it's OUT!!!
